intro: Paraboea changjiangensis, commonly known as the Changjiang paraboea, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent tube. It is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth.
